### Tender Announcement for Wheel Alignment Machine

**Reference Number:** WS4467322090-Doc4540775226
**Solicitation Number:** WS4467322090
**Publication Date:** 2024-04-17
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-05-10 14:00:00 EDT

**Description:**
The Department of National Defence (DND) requires one diagnostic wheel alignment machine for the Vehicle Maintenance Shop at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Kingston. The tender is open to all qualified bidders, and the selection will be based on the lowest price.

**Key Documents and Details:**

* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Notice URL:** <https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19417771?extsite=MTk0MTc3NzFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>
* **Contact Information:**
  - Julie Simms (SPAC/PSPC)
  - Email: julie.simms@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Important:**
Tenders must be submitted in accordance with the requirements outlined in the tender notice. All supporting documentation and bids must be submitted by 14:00 EDT on 2024-05-10. Failure to comply will result in non-responsiveness.

**Background:**

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and is open to all qualified bidders. The procurement method is competitive, and the tender will be evaluated based on the lowest price. The contracting entity reserves the right to accept or reject any tender. 

Please note the specific details regarding the tender and associated closing dates. Review the tender notice carefully to ensure full compliance with the requirements. 

Evaluation criteria and preferences will be based on the lowest price and trade agreements. The Government of Canada aims to stimulate the economy through procurement methods and partnerships with local and regional suppliers on previously announced priority themes. None of the tendering opportunities in this procurement require an evaluation criterion. All Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) qualified bidders are invited to submit bids for this RFP for supporting DND and its contributions to Canada’s government policy as well as its trade relationships.  Policies governing business activities are as they apply with DND (i.e. assist in the procurement process and advice and guidance on matters).  Please direct any requests or questions to: Canadian Free Trade Agreement Trade Officer,
